SEARCH
Package org.project.Controller.Control

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
org.project.Controller.Control.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class is responsible for managing the game logic and communication between the server, players, and the game model. It handles actions such as creating a game, joining a game, starting the game, making moves, and managing the game state. The controller acts as a bridge between the user interface and the game model, ensuring that the game rules are enforced and the game progresses correctly.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes the controller by resetting the lobby and game objects. Creates a new empty lobby and initializes a new game object with the server. Adds a property change listener to the game object to listen for changes in the game state.

    • recoverGame

      public void recoverGame(String name)

      public void linkModel2View()
      Links the model to the view by adding property change listeners to the players, game board, and game object, which update the view when changes occur.

    • playerOrder

      public List<Player> playerOrder(List<User> users)
      Generates a random order for the players based on the given list of users.
      Parameters:
      users - the list of users representing the players
      Returns:
      the list of players in a random order

    • create_game

      public boolean create_game(String username, boolean connectionType, int numPlayers) throws InvalidLoginException
      method for logging the FIRST player through the nickname.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      connectionType - =0 if connection is RMI, =1 if connection is Socket
      numPlayers - Number of players in the match
      Returns:
      true if the action was successful
      Throws:
      InvalidLoginException

    • join

      public boolean join(String username, boolean connectionType) throws InvalidLoginException
      method to join the game: if it is the first time you connect, you do a real login in which you add the client reference to the players list, otherwise it means that the player wants to reconnect and in this case if the username inserted corresponds to the username of a player who is in the list and whose boolean connected is set to false, then the action is accepted The method checks that the nickname is different for each logged in player.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      connectionType - =0 if connection is RMI, =1 if connection is Socket
      Returns:
      true if the action was successful
      Throws:
      InvalidLoginException

    • refreshRequest

      public void refreshRequest(String username)
      Sends a refresh request to the server for the specified username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player requesting a refresh

    • chat

      public boolean chat(String username, String text)
      Sends a chat message from the specified username with the given text. The message is sent to the server for broadcasting to all connected players.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player sending the chat message
      text - the content of the chat message
      Returns:
      true if the chat message was sent successfully, false otherwise

    • chat

      public boolean chat(String username, String text, String receiver)

      public boolean pick(String username, List<Coordinates> coordinates)
      method that allows the client to take tiles from the board
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      coordinates - coordinates of the tiles to be taken
      Returns:
      true if the action was successful

    • topUp

      public boolean topUp(String username, int column, int tileIndex)
      remote method that given a column as input, puts the drawn tiles in that column of the player's grid
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      column - Player's Choice Column
      tileIndex -
      Returns:
      true if the action was successful

    • quit

      public boolean quit(String username)
      method called when a player wants to drop out. A message of the event that occurred is sent to all.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name

    • correctPlayer

      public boolean correctPlayer(String username)

      public User getUser(String username)

    • warnNextPlayer

      public void warnNextPlayer()

    • handleStateException

      public void handleStateException(InvalidMoveException e, String username)
      Handles an InvalidMoveException by sending the exception information to the server. It sends the error message, user object associated with the username, and an identifier to the server.
      Parameters:
      e - The InvalidMoveException to handle.
      username - The username associated with the action that caused the exception.

    • lobbyCheck

      public void lobbyCheck()
      Checks the lobby to ensure at least one player is connected. If all players in the lobby are disconnected, it removes all users from the lobby, notifies the server's lock object, and sets the gameStarted flag to false.

    • launch

      public void launch(String[] args)
      Launches the application by initializing the server and the controller. It attempts to initialize the server and create a new instance of the controller. If any RemoteException occurs during the initialization process, it throws a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments
